intro: Geranium limae, commonly known as lemon geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves and clusters of small, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is often used in aromatherapy and as a natural insect repellent. Geranium limae is also popular in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
